meanings.definition: A circular or oval band of metal, wood, or other material.
meanings.sent1: She wore a beautiful gold tores on her wrist.
meanings.sent2: The tores of the bracelet were intricately carved.
meanings.sent3: He pretended the tores on his arm were magical bracelets.
meanings.sent4: The tores of sunlight peeked through the trees.
meanings.sent5: The tores of the hula hoop shimmered in the sun.

meanings.definition: A store or supply of something.
meanings.sent1: The pantry was filled with tores of canned goods.
meanings.sent2: She visited the tores to buy groceries for the week.
meanings.sent3: He joked that his tores of snacks were his treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her tores of knowledge on the subject were impressive.
meanings.sent5: The tores of books in the library seemed endless.

meanings.sent1: She carefully tores the ribbons to make a bow.
meanings.sent2: He tores the wires together to connect them.
meanings.sent3: The magician tores the scarves to create a trick.
meanings.sent4: The dancer tores her body gracefully in the performance.
meanings.sent5: The wind tores the leaves from the trees in autumn.
